image.caption: Collection of the U.S. House of Representatives

profileText: (Brother of Philip Miller Crane), a Representative from Illinois; born in Chicago, Cook County, Ill., January 10, 1936; attended the public schools of Chicago; A.B., Hillsdale College, Hillsdale, Mich., 1958; D.D.S., Indiana University, Indianapolis, Ind., 1963; graduate work, University of Michigan, 1964-1965; dentist; United States Army, captain, 1967-1970; elected as a Republican to the Ninety-sixth and to the two succeeding Congresses (January 3, 1979-January 3, 1985); censured by the U.S. House of Representatives on July 20, 1983, for personal misconduct with a House Page; unsuccessful candidate for reelection to the Ninety-ninth Congress in 1984; resumed the practice of dentistry; died on May 28, 2019, in Danville, Ill; interment at Rose Hill Cemetery, Hillsboro, Ind.

researchRecord.name: 1978-1984; 2 commercials on 2 videoreels, 2 commercials on 1 videocassette, and 6 commercials on 1 sound tape reel.
researchRecord.description: The commercials were used during Daniel Crane's campaigns for the 1978, 1982 and 1984 U. S. congressional elections in Illinois, 19th District, Republican Party.

recordLocation.name: The Julian P. Kanter Political Commercial Archive, Department of Communication
